column5: all signed up
can ya post a start and finish time bro
Sorry about that! Its now posted on the site  7am - 2pm
I might be up for this, I just have to see if the girlfriend is up for camping that weekend!  (too poor for a cottage)
Dang! That would be fun...I'll be at Lakair that weekend :-(
Don't worry Roy, there's always next year! If this year is a success, then I will for sure organize another for next year!

Any exceptions for boats of 4? I might be able to talk my girlfriend and her parents into registering. They aren't into competitive fishing but I'm dieing to join a little touney and they are usually on love sick lake so I could probably be able to get there with them.

i'm gonna try my damndest to get the day off work and find a partner with a boat... hahaha  i've got some smallies out of rice topping 6lbs in the past... i'd love to get out there for a mini-tourney like this...
Forgot to tell you all, tournament rules are you must share your best spots with me (especially with smallies over 6lbs), in order to register for the tourny!!
all signed up

Just an update:  There are 7 boats registered so far, which means only 13 spots remain. There are only 2 rental boats remaining. Registration and rental boats are first come, first serve.  www.stoty.com/tournament
We are registered but it might be A GOOD IDEA to start a new thread about the tournament so that everyone knows that it is a go.   vance
Count me in, Maybe the mods should Pin this thread??
WHOA!!!!Live bait permitted???Maybe someone should organize another tournament with no live bait.....
This is just a "fun" tournament, with anglers of all skill levels. So yes live bait is permitted.
Live Bait, Forget about it, count me out.
Patrick....did you already register via the website?
Would love to be in your tourny but thats opening weekend for ducks.Next year the weekend before or after and I'll be in for sure.Good luck to all.
just seen the other thread. Good call.

Hey everyone,  My buddy and I are thinking about holding a small Bass tournament on Rice Lake in September and were wondering if anyone would be interested in fishing it?  $15/team winners take all. 3 Bass limit  Preferably have your own boat, but not recommended.  Its nothing serious or anything, just an excuse to get out of the house and enjoy a days fishing.  PM me if you're interested or want more info.  Cheers, *Jamie
I'm on Rice the weekend after labour day...  i just sent you details... check your PMs
I'd be up for it if I could find a partner (with a boat).
I talked to my buddy and if the tournament is to happen, it will be Saturday, September 20.

I may be interested but we will see(its too early now). I wanted to join a bass club and do some tournaments but I talked to the club leader and wasn't impressed to say the least.  Would like the feel of competitive bass fishing. I don't know Rice lake that well and I don't expect to win, but I like the pressure!!And the price is right.Sounds like fun.  Post it again a week before.  Maybe OFC should start its own Bass Club. And have Tournaments.

Johnny, that actually sounds like a good idea. The planning and prep work would be tremendous for those willing to undertake it, but I think the turn out would be good. I am not a huge Bass guy anymore either, but it would be fun to participate in something like that.
Hey - fun tournaments would be great - $20-$30/boat is a good price and gets the competitive juices flowing.  As for Rice - don't think I have anything on that week in September, so it may work out.

Sweet!  I am working on a little website for the tourny, which will have all the details. It should be a good day for sure! I will post the link once the sites done.  Thanks for the responses guys!  *Jamie
sounds like fun, $15-20 for a team entry, depending how many teams, maybe have 3 payouts, that would help people at least pay for the gas in there boats and vehicles for a day.
Planned on taking that weekend off for a kawartha trip anyway. Will be in the area, so I'll probably be at the tourney!
Awesome, sounds good guys.  If we get a good turn out this year, we would like to make it an annual thing.

Ah man.  I wish there were more tournies that happened on Sundays.  I won't be able to make it.  Rice is however just down the road from the inlaws so it is a great spot for me to go to.  Sounds like a lot of fun.
count me and my buddy in for that weekend.
Keep this post alive with update info, sounds like a great excuse to dust the old tournament gear off. It's been 10 years since my last one and Rice was one of my fav lakes.  Bewdley launch??
Sounds like fun. I just need someone to tow my boat there.
I am in. Please post final details. Matt
I'm in for it as well.
Sounds Great But ill be at Lakair with alot of the OFC gang should make for the last weekend of the month..
Definite maybe for at least one boat or  two.  vance
If theres a boater,that needs a non for this,Im game. Keep this thread alive
i'm definitely game as long as i'm not working.  Beers at Rhino's after
im in(even thou iv'e never fished rice !!! best way to learn i guess  lol)
Stoty, Are you considering the 27-28th..of Sept. If so, you can pencil us in at the moment provided we survive the Stoney Lake Combo the week before without any propbs witht teh boat.
It will be September 20. Most likely out of Gores Landing as of right now. Just finalizing the details, and will post them soon.

Ok guys, I believe we are good to go with the tournament.  For the final details and to register for the tournament, please go to www.stoty.com/tournament.  Please note: All teams MUST register beforehand.  Thanks again for the interest, and lets hope we have a great turnout!  *Stoty
